summary.para: Notifies the docking window object that it is about to be removed from the frame. The docking window object should save any persistent information at this time.

param.name: dwReserved
param.para: Reserved. This parameter should always be zero.

returns.para: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

summary.para: Notifies the docking window object that the frame's border space has changed. In response to this method, the implementation must call , even if no border space is required or a change is not necessary.

param.name: prcBorder
param.para: Pointer to a structure that contains the frame's available border space.

param.name: punkToolbarSite
param.para: Pointer to the site's interface. The docking window object should call the method for this interface, requesting IID_IDockingWindowSite. The docking window object then uses that interface to negotiate its border space. It is the docking window object's responsibility to release this interface when it is no longer needed.

param.name: fReserved
param.para: Reserved. This parameter should always be zero.

returns.para: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

remarks.para: The prcBorder parameter contains the frame's entire available border space. The docking window object should negotiate its border space and then use this information to position itself.
For example, if the docking window object requires 25 pixels at the top of the border space, it should negotiate for this through the following steps:

item.description: Allocate a BORDERWIDTHS structure and set its top member to 25.
If the request is approved by , call to allocate the space.

remarks.para: The docking window object can then position its window at prcBorder->left and prcBorder->top. The width of the docking window object's window is determined by subtracting prcBorder->left from prcBorder->right. Its height is contained in the top member of the BORDERWIDTHS structure.

summary.para: Instructs the docking window object to show or hide itself.

param.name: fShow
param.para: TRUE if the docking window object should show its window. FALSE if the docking window object should hide its window and return its border space by calling with zero values.

returns.para: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

summary.para: Exposes methods that notify the docking window object of changes, including showing, hiding, and impending removal. This interface is implemented by window objects that can be docked within the border space of a Windows Explorer window.

remarks.para: IDockingWindow is derived from . See the following topics for details on these methods also available to IDockingWindow through that inheritance.
Implement IDockingWindow when you want to display a window inside a browser frame. This is typically used for user interface windows, such as toolbars.
You do not usually use the IDockingWindow interface directly. The Shell browser uses this interface to support docked windows inside the browser frame.
